conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions team. I’m Student_E and I’m very interested in joining School_A. I believe I would be a strong fit for your community and I’m ready to commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but I have relatively low priority there (4th), while several students (B, C, D) are ranked ahead and are likely to apply early. I am top priority at School_A and School_B, and School_A is also high on my true list (3rd). To maximize the chance of securing a strong outcome immediately and avoid being shut out by competition at School_C/School_D, I should apply to School_A in round 1 where I am most likely to be accepted.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A and would be excited to welcome you to our community.
conversation.thought: Student_E is #1 on School_A's true priority list and has applied with commitment. Although Student_B also applied and ranks School_A first, Student_B is lower (#4) on our priority list. With quota 1, accepting Student_E immediately secures our top-choice match and there is no benefit in delaying given the risk of losing Student_E to School_C/School_D where they are also well-ranked.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_B and School_A is my first-choice school. I’m excited about the academic environment and would be committed to enrolling if offered a place. I’d like to formally submit my application and be considered for your available seat.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_D, Student_A), it’s still possible those higher-priority students choose other schools first (especially School_B/School_C, where they may have stronger chances). Applying now keeps me in contention for my first choice; if rejected, I can quickly pivot to School_B next round where I have high priority (2nd).

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and for naming School_A as your first choice. At this time, our incoming class is full and we are unable to offer you admission. We appreciate your interest in School_A and wish you the very best in the process.
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and already matched with Student_E, who is #1 on our true priority list. Remaining quota is 0, so per rules we must reject any new [APPLY] messages. Even absent the quota constraint, Student_E is preferred over Student_B (#4), so we would not displace the current match.

conversation.message: Dear School_B admissions team, I’m Student_A and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m very excited about the academic environment and would strongly commit to enrolling if admitted. I would be grateful for your consideration for your available seat.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me last in its priority list, waiting would only reduce my chances further, and there is no cost to applying early in this setting. I will express strong fit and commitment to try to secure the single seat if possible.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you very much for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing applications in this round relative to our selection priorities and limited seat availability, we’re unable to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your time and wish you the very best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Our true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round we received APPLYs from A, C, and D. Among them, C is highest on our list (rank 3), then D (rank 4), then A (rank 5). Since accepting A now would fill our only seat and block a better-ranked candidate who has already applied, we should reject A. Also, Student_E (our top) and Student_B (rank 2) have not contacted us yet; keeping flexibility is valuable. Therefore reject Student_A politely, encouraging them to pursue other options.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee. I’m Student_C and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly value your academic environment and would be excited to contribute positively to the community if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. I have relatively strong priority there (School_B ranks me 3rd after Student_E and Student_B). Even if competition is high, applying now maximizes my chance to secure my first choice before the seat is taken.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_B. We are pleased to offer you admission and would be excited to have you join our community. Please confirm your commitment to enroll at School_B so we can finalize the match.
conversation.thought: As School_B, my true priority order is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I have applications from A, C, and D. Among these, Student_C is the highest-ranked (above D and A). I have quota 1 and can form a match immediately. While Student_E and Student_B are higher priorities, they have not contacted me this round; delaying risks losing Student_C to another school (C is also likely to be competitive for School_C, their second choice). Accepting Student_C now secures my best available option from current applicants within quota.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee—I'm Student_D. School_B is my first-choice school, and I’m very eager to join your community. I’m ready to commit if admitted and would be excited to contribute actively to academics and school life. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B’s priority list ranks me 4th, applying now gives me a chance before higher-priority students potentially commit elsewhere. If rejected, I can move quickly to my next choices (School_C, then School_A where I have strong priority).

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your application and for making School_B your first choice. At this time, we have already filled our available seat, so we’re unable to offer you admission in this round. We truly appreciate your interest and wish you the very best as you continue the matching process with other schools.
conversation.thought: Our remaining quota is 0 and we are already matched with Student_C. Per the rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] regardless of the applicant’s priority rank. Student_D is on our true priority list (ranked below Student_C and above Student_A), but we cannot accept without capacity, so we must reject while encouraging them to pursue other options.

conversation.message: Dear School_C admissions team, I’m Student_A. School_C is one of my top choices, and I would be excited to enroll if offered admission. I’m especially drawn to the academic culture and would fully commit to attending. Thank you very much for considering my application for your available seat.
conversation.thought: School_C is my 2nd true choice and is still available. I have low priority at School_C, so I should apply now with a strong commitment message rather than wait, since delaying likely won’t improve my standing and seats are scarce.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_C. After reviewing this round’s applicants and our current capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Current applicants this round: A, B, D. My true priority order is B > C > D > E > A, so Student_A is lowest priority. Since Student_B (top priority) has applied and is willing to commit, accepting A now would block a better match. Therefore reject A to preserve capacity for B (and potentially C later, but B is best).

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions, I’m Student_B. After this round of results, School_C is my top remaining choice, and I would be ready to commit and enroll if offered admission. I’m excited by School_C’s academic community and would be grateful to be considered for your available seat. Thank you for your time and consideration.
conversation.thought: School_A already rejected me and School_B is no longer available, so the best remaining option on my true preference list is School_C. I also have the top priority at School_C (they rank Student_B first), so a direct application should be accepted if their seat is still open. I will clearly state School_C is my top remaining choice and that I would enroll if admitted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for expressing your commitment to School_C. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. We believe you would be a strong fit for our academic community, and we look forward to welcoming you.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received APPLY from Students A, B, and D. On School_C’s true priority list, Student_B is ranked #1, Student_D is #3, and Student_A is last (#5) and was already rejected previously. Since Student_B is the top choice and is stating willingness to commit, accepting now secures our best attainable match and avoids the risk of losing B to School_A or School_B in later rounds. Therefore, accept Student_B.

conversation.message: Dear School_C Admissions Committee, I’m Student_D. After reflecting on my goals, I’m very excited about the academic environment and community at School_C, and I would be eager to join and contribute. I’m ready to commit if admitted and would be grateful for your consideration. Thank you for reviewing my application.
conversation.thought: School_B (my top choice) already rejected due to its seat being filled. Among the remaining unmatched schools, School_C is my next highest true preference. Given the one-seat capacities, waiting risks losing School_C to higher-priority applicants, so I should apply immediately and signal strong commitment and fit.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_C. At this time, our available seat has already been filled, so we’re not able to offer you admission in this round. We appreciate your time and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (remaining quota 0) with Student_B, who is also our top priority. Per rules, we must reject any new APPLY when quota is 0. Student_D is on our priority list but cannot be accommodated unless a seat opens, which is not possible under current matched status.

conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions Committee, I’m Student_D. With other options closing, I’ve reflected carefully and School_E stands out as a place where I can truly thrive and contribute to the community. I would be excited to join School_E and am ready to commit immediately if admitted. Thank you very much for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top two choices (School_B and School_C) have already filled their seats. Among the remaining unmatched schools, School_E is higher on my true preference list than School_D, so I should apply to School_E now to maximize my outcome. I will signal strong interest and willingness to commit if admitted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for your interest in School_E. After reviewing our current applicant pool and available seat, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We truly appreciate you considering School_E, and we wish you the very best in your placement.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: School_E has quota 1 and received APPLYs from Student_D and Student_A this round. On School_E’s true priority list, Student_A is ranked 1st while Student_D is ranked 5th (last). Since Student_A is currently available and is offering to commit immediately, accepting Student_D now would block a strictly better outcome for School_E. Therefore reject Student_D to preserve the seat for Student_A.

conversation.message: Dear School_E admissions team, I’m Student_A. I’m very interested in School_E and would be excited to enroll if offered admission. If accepted, I will commit to attending and withdraw from other options. Thank you for considering my application for your available seat.
conversation.thought: School_B and School_C (my top two) already rejected me, and only School_D and School_E remain unmatched. On my true preference list, School_E is ranked above School_D, and School_E also has me ranked #1 in its priority list, making acceptance very likely if I apply now. Securing School_E is the best achievable outcome at this stage and avoids the risk of losing the last acceptable seat.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your clear commitment to School_E. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_E. We’re excited about the possibility of you joining our community, and we look forward to welcoming you.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: As School_E, my true priority ranks Student_A highest, and Student_A has submitted a binding-style APPLY message (will commit and withdraw). I have 1 seat remaining and also received an APPLY from Student_D, who is last on my priority list and was previously rejected. Given full information, accepting Student_A is optimal and secures my top-choice match immediately; there is no benefit to delaying since no candidate outranks Student_A for me.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_D. I understand you still have an available seat, and I would like to formally apply. While my earlier applications did not work out due to seats filling, I have strong respect for School_D’s community and academic environment, and I’m confident I would contribute positively and take full advantage of the opportunities at your school.

If admitted, I’m ready to commit immediately. Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (though last). Since other higher-ranked schools have already filled their seats and rejected me, the best way to secure any match is to apply to School_D now. I will express genuine interest, readiness to commit, and highlight fit, aiming to convert the remaining open seat into an acceptance.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and thoughtful message. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. We appreciate your interest in our community and are confident you will be a strong addition.

Welcome to School_D.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_D is #1 on School_D’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and no current matches. Student_D is applying now and is willing to commit immediately. Accepting secures our top choice and there is no reason to risk holding out for a higher-ranked student (none exist).
